page.title: 09Village Events
page.content: {St Faith's Church, Hexton,}was built in{1114.}Village people worship there each Sunday. Every Christmas the school children sing at the carol service. The old{Church often needs {repairing.}A{'Knit_In'}was organised. Grandma's, Aunties, Mothers and Children volunteered. They asked friends to pay them money for every inch they knitted.{Â£700 was raised}to help the Church. At Hexton 'Fun Run' runners asked friends to pay them for every mile they ran round Hexton and Pegsdon. Â£315 was raised for the Church and the Youth Club.{Hexton Fete is held{annually}in the Manor grounds. There is a Dog Show with competitions for the best breeds and most obedient dogs. There are motor bike rides and pony rides and a Punch and Judy puppet show.
